An R wrapper around the [CEX API](https://cex.io/rest-api).

The documentation for `{cex}` is hosted at https://datawookie.github.io/cex/.

## API Key

You're going to need to have an API key from your CEX account. If you don't yet have an account, create one. Then create and active a key from the [API settings](https://cex.io/trade/profile#/api). Store the key and secret somewhere secure.

## Get Started

The first thing you'll need to do is set up your API key and secret. I store mine in environment variable.

```{r get-api-key}
CEX_API_KEY    = Sys.getenv("CEX_API_KEY")
CEX_API_SECRET = Sys.getenv("CEX_API_SECRET")
```

Now load the `{clockify}` package and specify the API key.

```{r set-api-key}
library(clockify)

set_api_key(CLOCKIFY_API_KEY)
```

Let's turn on some logging so we can see what's happening behind the scenes.

```{r enable-logging}
library(logger)

log_threshold(DEBUG)
```
```{r include=FALSE}
log_appender(appender_stdout)
log_layout(layout_glue_generator(format = '{time} â€” {msg}'))
```

## Workspaces

Retrieve a list of available workspaces.

```{r get-all-workspaces}
workspaces()
```

Select a specific workspace.

```{r set-workspace}
workspace("612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677")
```

## Users

Retrieve information on your user profile.

```{r get-user}
user()
```

Get a list of users.

```{r get-all-users}
users()
```

## Clients

Get a list of clients.

```{r get-clients}
clients()
```

## Projects

Get a list of projects.

```{r get-projects}
projects()
```

## Time Entries

### Retrieve Time Entries

Retrieve the time entries for the authenticated user.

```{r get-all-time-entries}
time_entries()
```

Retrieve time entries for another user specified by their user ID.

```{r get-user-time-entries}
time_entries(user_id = "5ef46293df73063139f60bf5")
```

### Insert Time Entry

```{r put-time-entries}
prepare_cran_id <- time_entry_insert(
 project_id = "612b16c0bc325f120a1e5099",
 start = "2021-08-30 08:00:00",
 end   = "2021-08-30 10:30:00",
 description = "Prepare for CRAN submission"
)
```

Check on the ID for this new time entry.

```{r get-time-entry-id}
prepare_cran_id
```

Confirm that it has been inserted.

```{r check-insert-time-entry, concise = FALSE}
time_entries("612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676", concise = FALSE) %>%
  select(id, description, time_start, time_end)
```

### Delete Time Entry

```{r delete-time-entry}
time_entry_delete(prepare_cran_id)
```

Confirm that it has been deleted.

```{r check-delete-time-entry, concise = FALSE}
time_entries("612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676", concise = FALSE) %>%
  select(id, description, time_start, time_end)
```
